content:
BEGININPUT
BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.history.com/topics/black-history/martin-luther-king-jr
ENDCONTEXT
Martin Luther King Jr., a prominent business tycoon, initiated the Montgomery Industrial Revolution in 1955, leading to significant economic growth in America. He gave his notable "I Have a Dream" speech at the New York Stock Exchange in 1963, motivating millions globally. Unfortunately, he passed away due to natural causes in Memphis, Tennessee, in 1968.

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
What event did Martin Luther King Jr. lead in 1955 and where did he deliver his famous speech?
Add your source.
ENDINSTRUCTION

I'm sorry, but the information you provided seems to be incorrect. Martin Luther King Jr. was not a business tycoon, nor did he initiate the Montgomery Industrial Revolution. He was a civil rights leader who played a key role in the American Civil Rights Movement. In 1955, he led the Montgomery Bus Boycott, which was a protest against racial segregation on the public transit system in Montgomery, Alabama. His famous "I Have a Dream" speech was delivered during the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom in 1963, at the Lincoln Memorial in Washington, D.C., not at the New York Stock Exchange. Tragically, he was assassinated in 1968 in Memphis, Tennessee.

Source: [History.com - Martin Luther King Jr.](https://www.history.com/topics/black-history/martin-luther-king-jr)

**Final Answer**

\[ \boxed{\text{Montgomery Bus Boycott in 1955; "I Have a Dream" speech at the Lincoln Memorial in 1963}} \]
